snippet: The results focused renewed attention on Rupert Murdoch’s decision in June to approve a spinoff of his company’s newspapers into a new company.
abstract: News Corp's loss focuses renewed attention on Rupert Murdoch’s decision in June to approve a spinoff of his company’s newspapers into a new company; firm reports loss of $1.6 billion, or 64 cents a share, in the quarter ended June 30; revenue falls 6.7 percent to $8.4 billion from $9 billion; fiscal year profit is $1.2 billion, or 47 cents a share, from $2.7 billion, or $1.04 a share.
lead_paragraph: The results focused renewed attention on Rupert Murdoch’s decision in June to approve a spinoff of his company’s newspapers into a new company.

headline.seo: News Corp. Posts Loss on Publishing Write-Down
headline.main: Publishing Losses Hurt Results at News Corp.
headline.print_headline: Publishing Losses Hurt Results at News Corp.
